timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/apache/incubator-iotdb into new_query_interface
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/apache/incubator-iotdb into new_query_interface
re-interrupt the method while occurring InterruptedException

timeline.bodyText: If the timestamp is truly a "0", will it be translated into space? If so, I don't think it is reasonable.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: These "2"s appear frequently, I suggest replace them with a constant and add a comment for the constant to explain what column is skipped.
timeline.author: jt2594838
jt2594838

 package org.apache.iotdb;

timeline.bodyText: I don't think you should remove the old examples unless they are incorrect, you should only add the new ones.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: It would be better if you just make it a List of TsDataType, it is unnecessary to convert a string to TsDataType every time.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: "Info" is too ambiguous, just call it "columnName".
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: It would be more clear to call it "columnBufferPositionMap" or "columnOrdinalMap" or something else.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText:
Always keep the stack trace unless you are sure the exception is minor.
throw new SQLException("Error occurs when connecting to server for close operation ", e);
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: These methods are duplicated with the aligned one, better to extract them into a base class like "IoTDBResultSet".
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: I have to say, your current way of dealing with null values is not satisfactory, maybe a bitmap will help.
timeline.author: jt2594838
jt2594838

replies.bodyText:
This just imitates the code in IoTDBQueryResultSet.
Maybe I will change to the way you said next time
replies.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: Always use "{}" for code blocks (even if it only contains a single line), as we obey the google code-style.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: This field is not necessary if you make ReadTask a non-static class.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: You may just wrap the byte[] in the BAOS with ByteBuffer.wrap() as it does not seem you will reuse it.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: Is it necessary to use atomic objects? Will there be concurrent modifications on the same index? I thought all read tasks are working on different indexes.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: It may be better to also end this query in case anyone forgets to close the resultset.
timeline.author: jt2594838
